page.title: 16Churches 2
page.content: The Roman Catholic Church of St Thomas and St Stephen in Great Hales St. is the centre of a parish covering 150 square miles.The regular Sunday congregation of nearly 300 is led by Reverend Father Woodier.He is supported in his parish work by parish sisters.The Methodist are building a new church which is due to be opened in Sept 1985.Led by circuit Minister, Rev Douglas Savill about 100 members attend Sunday worship.A whole range of clubs also meet catering for all ages from toddlers to pensioners. The Pentecostal Church,the former Salvation Army Hall, in Shrewsbury Rd. is supported by a small but enthusiastic band of followers. The Independent Methodists meet at their terraced church in Shropshire St. Jehovah's Witnesses and Baptists also meet at various halls in the town.
